p: The first epidemic, caused by the Indian Ocean lineage, started in coastal Kenya in august 2004 with an attack rate of over 50% [ 2] and rapidly disseminated to the Comoros islands in December 2004â€“March 2005 [ 28], and from there to Mayotte, Mauritius, La Reunion, and the Seychelles [ 29], infecting hundreds of thousands of people at the end of 2005 through the beginning of 2006. Because La Reunion Island is a French territory with a developed public health infrastructure and surveillance system, the epidemic gathered more global attention after making the headlines. It also disseminated through India and South-East Asia, and into southern Europe because of air travel, causing altogether approximately six million cases in more than 40 countries [ 2, 3].
